socorro_links.comment_text:
Crash report: https://crash-stats.mozilla.org/report/index/82b660f6-5b6f-415f-be8f-1d4ed0251005



Reason: ```EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION_READ```


Top 10 frames of crashing thread:
```
0  igd12um64xel.dll  igd12um64xel.dll@0xc9e6f  
1  igd12um64xel.dll  igd12um64xel.dll@0xc9305  
2  igd12um64xel.dll  igd12um64xel.dll@0xef700f  
3  igd12um64xel.dll  igd12um64xel.dll@0xd82718  
4  igd12um64xel.dll  igd12um64xel.dll@0xc8f52  
5  igd12um64xel.dll  igd12um64xel.dll@0xc8ebc  
6  D3D12Core.dll  std::vector<D3D12_INDIRECT_ARGUMENT_DESC, std::allocator<D3D12_INDIRECT_ARGUMENT_DESC> >::_Resize_reallocate<std::_Value_init_tag>  
7  D3D12Core.dll  CCommandSignature::FinalConstruct  
8  D3D12Core.dll  CLayeredObject<CCommandSignature>::CreateInstance  
9  D3D12Core.dll  CDevice::CreateLayeredChild  
```



By querying Nightly crashes reported within the last 2 months, here are some insights about the signature:

- **First crash report:** 2025-10-05
- **Process type:** GPU
- **Is startup crash:** No
- **Has user comments:** No
- **Is null crash:** Yes - all crashes happened on null or near null memory address






By analyzing the backtrace, the regression may have been introduced by a patch [1] to fix Bug 1990641.

[1] https://hg.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/rev?node=1c042e689b9c



:sergesanspaille, since you are the author of the potential regressor, could you please take a look?
